title: Can we have a serious discussion about Tryndamere please?
body: I honestly don't think he is healthy for this game. You can crush him in lane, and he can still split push better than any top laner because of his ult, free crit, and heal. He only needs a few items and you're all set, and it only gets worse the more items he gets. I think it's completely absurd that even if you crush him in lane he's still relevant. And you tell us to CC him, but his ult will still go off even when hard cc'd. So please tell me, because clearly I'm a bronze noob who has no idea what I'm doing, how the hell do you deal with a Tryndamere?

replies.body: Tanks screw him.  His ult isn't a problem, since he is so vulnerable to CC and ignites.  Sure, he can splitpush.  But if your team is smart, then when he starts splitpushing you guys will group as a team and win teamfights because they are down a player.  Splitpushing only works if you don't sieze that advantage.

_or_ trynda's team can defend 4v5 under turret with wave clearing and just makes it so trynda can free split. If you send someone there, then your siege is over, and their team had an advantage because the time it takes for one of you to get back to top lane is enough time for trynda to take a turret.

Tanks don't really screw him, unless the tank is fed and trynda isn't, in which case he just runs away with his E and Ult if needed. If you're trying to say tanks screw him in team fights, that would be true, except he doesn't really team fight

Tanks generally screw him regardless of how fed they are.   Build a thornmail against him and watch him kill himself.   Its not like Tryndamere is such an amazing champion.  He is similiar to Master Yi in a way.  Somewhat easy to play and use, but not very hard to beat assuming people know what they are doing in game.

yi and trynda are not that much alike in that regard. Yi actually takes skill to play at a high lvl, trynda is very braindead, only requires some game knowledge and match up experience at most to do well with (unless you jungle, in which more emphasis in knowledge, less in match ups). The difference between a skilled Yi (like cowsep) and those "hurr engage with alpha strike and right click" yi is absurdly higher than that of a tryndamere main and someone who just randomly decides to pick trynda.

And no, tanks don't generally screw him. Some bruisers can work against him, but then again if he randomly crits twice in a roll at lvl 2 it's kinda gg regardless so there's that, but anyways, in a match up where trynda can't outright kill you, he just farms and farms with his free sustain, and if needed (ganked?) just rolls and imortalities away. He'll eventually outscale almost anything. Try and pick a tank, let's say a Rammus, who's verily known as anti-ad, against a tryndamere and rush a thornmail. Proceed to watch him ignore you and kill your wave, while you can't kill minions for shit and just lose a ton of CS and get behind and then die to him when he decides to jump at you with a few items ahead.

A malphite could work I guess, i don't have experience in that match up but I guess with the attack speed slow and the kiting with Q he could do allright, but then again, trynda will just ignore him and split push, malph can't really stop trynda from pushing and eventually goes oom while trynda perma-sustains

> but then again if he randomly crits twice in a roll at lvl 2 it's kinda gg regardless so there's that

That's the only problem I have with Trynd.
Hell, I can take {{champion:201}} top and make his life miserable. That lvl 1 double crit though. I have no way of dealing with it because I have no way of predicting it.

(though I would swear to it Trynd has a hidden passive that buffs his crit chance at low levels.)
His passive+ crit normalizer. It's basically a hidden passive.

TBH, CC, smart positioning, and kiting screw tryndamere over more than Yi. Yi has slow immunity, gapclose that also can dodge things, meditate, and resets to help him in teamfights. A good Yi player can avoid a lot of damage while delivering assloads back.

Tryndamere just has 5 seconds where he can't die and a short to mid range gapclose and that's it. If your ADC doesn't moronically get close enough to tryn for him to spin behind them, his ult gets blown immediately and he gets kited for 5 seconds.

I actually think that Tryndamere has a comparably decent team fight as master yi. Yes Yi can dodge skills and AoE hit champs with his Alpha Strike, and then be able to use it again if he gets kills, but Tryndamere has a AoE 80 AD reduction, AND 60% slow if anyone is even angled away from him. Idk about some people, but for a lot of people, 80 AD is A LOT of damage to lose for 5 seconds.

Also Tryndamere can soak damage. If he is as dangerous as most say, then the enemy team relies on killing him first. And if your mid is LeBlanc or Zed or Ekko, then a Trynd will be a much bigger burden if he builds regular:

{{item:3153}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3074}} --> He can handle tanks and have AoE damage. He will get reliable damage done, and it doesn't need to be to the back line.

take away that hydra and get a {{item:3072}} and youre fine.
I much prefer BT to hydra
But doesn't your waveclear suffer? I mean he's great at it already, but hydra lets him clear in a two seconds.

Depending on which situation it will become you have to act accordingly, most solo queue teams have troubles dealing with him because it's hard to take advantage of the 4v5 situation before it ends up being a stalemate at a turret in said games so more likely than not you'll just send someone top to stop him, and if they can stop him 1 on 1 they're more likely not someone who is invaluable to a teamfight therefore preventing you from 4v4ing. Which is the solo queue tryndamere issue, this is an entirely different situation in 5v5 ranked teams though where people are more coordinated, which is why he will not receive any nerfs. He CAN be dealt with, but without your entire team being on voice chat or being very coordinated as a whole it's much more difficult to do so.

Last I checked 80% of the champs in league are vulnerable to CC so what makes it worse for him? So let's say you hard cc him and then follow up by bursting him down. He can then ult(while cc'd), throw down a massive AD reduction and proceed to kill you for getting that close. If you did the same thing to a riven or fiora they would get destroyed. Do it a tryndamere and it's all k.

And as far as us poor adcs there's no hope. You need 5 seconds of hard or strong slowing cc to survive.

Obviously save your CC for when he ults lol.  Why would you CC him when he is at full health knowing that he has his ultimate up?  He really isn't a problem.  He is a low level pubstomper because people are not familiar enough with the game to know how to beat him.  He either gets really fed, and kills and dies quickly or he falls behind and just splitpushes.  Neither of which are a real problem.

I guess I'm just thinking of it from a mid-late game perspective (as I don't really play top much). You would cc him because he's diving directly at the squishy carry. And if he gets there you're likely screwed. I suppose this is less of an issue if the team can cooperate well. I feel he thrives in chaotic situations. So I guess CC is less his counter than just teamwork.

Riot already knows he is unhealthy so they keep him weak.  They wanted to rework him and remove his ult but they decided against it due to it being his identity.   To beat him I would say play someone like {{champion:13}} to out range him and force team fights so he can't split-push.

How is he any more unhealthy than many of the champions currently running around? Isn't that whole "still useful even when beaten" thing part of Riot's big plan for a healthier game? So why is it that when Tryndamere accomplishes this he's called unhealthy?

If it's solely because of his ult, then.. it's arguably not even the strongest survival tool of the melee carries. I've always wondered why he gets called unhealthy for being able to be relevant even when he gets the shit beaten out of him, yet when other champions do that it's perfectly normal and healthy. He's not even the only carry that does it. It seems like the whole idea of "melee carry" seems to just be unhealthy in general, since every time they come out Riot is chastised for them.

Only Bronze and Silvers would say such a thing. People who don't know how to handle split pushing. If Tryndamere is pushing top, then you can 4v5 and win the teamfight with ease. Or you can send your top laner to stop him.  If a fight happens your top laner usually has TP and can tp to you guys. Split pushing is a strategy and is very risky because yes you might take a tower if you are a good split pusher, but what good is that tower when your team is constantly dying because the game is a 4v5.

If you really think Trynda is easy to play or broken, then try to play him. He's not an expensive champion

>If Tryndamere is pushing top, then you can 4v5 and win teamfights with ease

That's when you send your top laner up top to stop him, OR you can just get a free baron and then go top as a group and kill him.

You send a top laner, they engage 4v4. A smart split-pushing Tryn is warding as he pushes, to try to ensure maxium escape potential, so he's going to see you trying to baron. Which means they know you're baroning, allowing them to try and steal/kill your team.

He doesn't need to be changed just because people who play dumb die to him. Might as well take away Heimer's turrets bc they are his identity and dumb people die to him and he pushes fast.

He isn't relevant after you crush him, that's part of what makes him very unhealthy for the game. The team that has an underfed or farmed {{champion:23}} has a huge weight to carry. He either gets a little fed, then roams to other lanes crushing them, or he loses lane very badly and loses for the rest of the game. It's why so many rage quit if they don't get fed.

His kit is so annoying, but easy to overcome. It's designed to overwhelm a lot of players, but when you figure out how to build/outplay him, he just becomes an annoyance until you start dominating the lane. After that it's a cake walk. 

I play {{champion:114}} against him quite a bit, and I have no CC, and I'm not terribly tanky. When I'm up against him though I rush {{item:3047}} and {{item:3075}} . I also get {{item:3140}} and build it into {{item:3139}} . {{summoner:14}} this spell is essential for your match up because of his ult. However the best time to shut him down is always pre 6, so pick a champion with a decent early game, or ask for a gank. Trade with him frequently, and this should be easy because his bar requires him to push the lane.

Although he's not difficult to outplay, and doesn't require a lot of skill to beat for most champions, I do think he's toxic for this game. He sucks all the fun out of playing top lane, and I see him so much in my unranked normal games because people in bronze/silver fall victim to his ridiculous kit. 

The most problematic part of him is that if he gets fed off of others, then you're in for a miserable game where you basically have to avoid him unless you have the full team. I wish they would rework him already.
